news uk-news meghan-markle-doesnt-want-told-"Levin: Meghan ‘doesn’t want to be told, doesn’t listen to detail’ByRyan FaheyReporter:,  Nov Meghan Markle doesnapost want to be told what to do as new evidence is revealed in her bitter court row with a British newspaper, a royal biographer claims. Prince Harryaposs official biographer Angela Levin says Meghan is brushing off new evidence in her court battle with the Mail on Sunday asitaposs nothing. But the details being revealed by former aide Jason Knauf at the High Court are very serious and could cause signicant damage to her reputation, Ms Levin says. The new evidence lead Meghan to issue an apology statement, in which she said she hadnapost remembered the emails between her and Mr Knauf and had no wish or intention to mislead the court. It comes amid the final stages of Meghanaposs legal fight with the publishers of the Mail on Sunday, Associated Newspapers Ltd . The mum-of-two, , took issue with the paper printing what she says was a private and personal five-page letter written to her estranged dad, Thomas Markle. In the letter the Duchess begs him to not speak to the media about her. Though Meghan won her case at the High Court in February, ANL appealed - and they claim to have bombshell details which could overturn the decision.  Yesterday Meghan was forced to apologise to the court for not disclosing emails in which she attempted to influence a biography about her and Harry. The emails, released by the Court of Appeal, showed that two years ago the couple gave press spokesman Jason Knauf a detailed brief before meeting biography writers Omid Scobie and Carolyn Durand. Another email exchange, revealed by Mr Knauf, showed messages Meghan wrote to estranged dad Thomas, , after the royal wedding. Meghan told him she would call him daddy to pull at the heartstringsthe messages were leaked, Mr Knauf claimed.  The -year-old Duchess has strongly denied helping Scobie and Durand to write the Finding Freedom biography. But in  pages of court documents, Mr Knauf swore the Sussexes told him what to tell the authors. Palace aides are finally getting their own back at the Sussexes, Ms Levin - who spent a year with Harry writing his biography - told GB News. I think the whole thing is absolutely extraordinary, she told the broadcaster.  What is astonishing is that the Palace aides are now talking and saying what they think has really happened. Before, they followed the Queenaposs motto - which is to never complain and never explain, and staff did this too. But Meghan and Harry are a dferent breed now and [their comments are] thought to be so unfair and wrong that aides now going to speak about their views. She claims the Duchess tried brushing away Mr Knaufaposs evidence as though itaposs nothing.  But Ms Levin claims in the court setting she was in It is very serious. She explained: What she said in court was not true and I think her credibility will suffer for this in a signicant way. Ms Levin says the Duchess is also desperate to not lose against the publisher.  She doesnapost like to be beaten - she wants to win, and sometimes she goes overboard, she said. She doesnapost listen to detail, she doesnapost want to be told, she just wants to forge ahead. In a new witness statement, Meghan apologised to the court and accepted Mr Knauf did brief the Finding Freedom authors with her knowledge. She said: I apologise to the Court for the fact that I had not remembered these exchanges at the time. I had absolutely no wish or intention to mislead the Defendant or the Court. The Duchess added that had she known about the emails she would have been more than happy to refer to them as strongly supportive of her case. The Finding Freedom biography, published in August , detailed the married lives of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex - and their infamous split from the Royal Family. The book was described as an unauthorised biography, and the royal couple have previously denied that they were involved with its creation.However the Court of Appeal heard on Wednesday that Meghan and Harry authorised specic cooperation in writing in December  to the authors of Finding Freedom .The book was discussed directly with the Duchess multiple times in person and over email, the court heard, and Meghan was said to give him helpful written background reminders.Most ReadFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Mail on SundayMeghan MarklePrince HarryRoyal FamilyFinding Freedom" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news mum-two-who-partied-every-"Big Fish Little Fish rave for parents and childrenByZoe ChamberlainLeigh Mcmanus:,  Nov | comments A mother-of-two has revealed how she loves to go clubbing with her five-year-old son and how she uses Google Calendar to organise a routine with her partner of going out out.Sophie Parekh and her husband Rakesh, from Selly Oak, Birmingham, used to be out clubbing or going to festivals all the time before they had Leo. But when he came along, going out became a logistical nightmare. This misery was only compounded when Hari came along two years ago.“Six years ago I took a pregnancy test on board a train, ironically, to my friend’s baby shower,” said Sophie, , who is mum to Leo, five, and Hari, two.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here “When the two lines popped up I called my then bf, now hubby, and told him, he replied aposNo, f’in way!apos. He was in the queue to get into the Simmer Down Festival and was not in the state to be told such le altering news.“We were both partying most weekends and a baby just wouldn’t be practical for our bar hopping shenanigans - PST definitely doesn’t have baby changing facilities, she told Birmingham Live. She added: “And then came the power struggle once our son, Leo, arrived. Both tired, but both in desperate need for some time away from our colicky baby we found ourselves arguing all the time about who was getting a break next.” Not wanting to lose their pre-children lives, the couple had a sit down and began to map out when they could go out, together and separately.  She said that the plan wasnapost smooth initially. “If either of us did get out the other would be at home feeling resentful, jealous, even a little paranoid! “It took us another baby to smooth this out. Lots of long conversations led us to the conclusion that going out was the only thing that made both of us remember ourselves BC .” And so, Sophie and Rakesh started to go out again, both together and separately - but with some set rules in place. “We don’t have a strict timetable but we do have some loose rules - lie in only till am, donapost go out all the time and it needs to be put into our joint Google calendar at least a week in advance,” said Sophie, who met Rakesh seven years ago whilst both working for a small start-up company.  “We used to really resent itthe other went aposout outapos but we’ve come to find that it’s so good for our mental health to still do the things we liked doing before kids and let each other just be ‘us’ for a night. Sophie has since began organising family-friendly parties, under the name Big Fish Little Fish Raves. Following a sell-out Halloween family rave, Sophie is hosting a Pyjama Family Rave called Sweet Dreams are Made of This at Popworld on Broad Street, Birmingham on January . news uk-news prince-charles-gives-well-wishers-"Prince Charles tells well-wishers the Queen is all rightByLaura ElstonAlice Peacock:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsPrince Charles reassured a bystander about the health of the Queen as he met members of the public in London. The Prince of Wales was greeted by crowds of people as he left a branch of NatWest bank in Brixton, south London, after an engagement for the Princeaposs Trust on Thursday. One man asked him: Prince Charles. How is your mother  The heir to the throne gave him an encouraging pat on the arm, and appeared to say: Sheaposs alright, thank you. The Queen, , has been under doctorsapos orders to rest during the past three weeks after undergoing medical tests and spending a night in hospital on October . She has ed to Windsor Castle on Tuesday after spending six days at Sandringham, where she was believed to have been preparing to welcome her family for Christmas. She conducted a Privy Council meeting by video link from the castle on Wednesday afternoon, with ministers including Lord President of the Council Jacob Rees-Mogg and Education Secretary Nadhim Zahawi among others.The -year-old monarch is understood to be feeling refreshed after spending time at her later husband Prince Philipaposs former home, Wood Farm on the vast Sandringham estate. Though the monarch has said she will miss the annual Festival of Remembrance at the Royal Albert Hall on Saturday, Buckingham Palace has said it is her firm intention to be at the Remembrance Sunday service at the Cenotaph. However, her attendance has yet to be confirmed. The Queen is commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces and has only ever missed six Remembrance Sunday services in the capital, four due to royal tours and two when she was pregnant.  The Prince of Wales and the Duchess of Cornwall are expected to lead other members of the royal family on Saturday at the annual remembrance event at the Royal Albert Hall. This would include the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, the Earl and Countess of Wessex and the Princess Royal. Her Majesty has been told to ease up on her hectic schedule after she was last month forced to spend a night in hospital, with specialist doctors at the King Edward VII hospital in Marylebone, London, performing a series of tests described as “preliminary investigations”.  She was forced to cancel a two day trip to Northern Ireland at the last minute as well as a planned appearance at the COP climate change conference last week. Courtiers are understood to be working towards managing the Queen’s diary accordingly for the next few weeks leading up to Christmas, while she will continue to undertake light duties at Windsor Castle. In a statement, Buckingham Palace said: Following on from their recent advice that the Queen should rest for a few days, Her Majestyaposs doctors have advised that she should continue to rest for at least the next two weeks.  The doctors have advised that Her Majesty can continue to undertake light, desk-based duties during this time, including some virtual audiences, but not to undertake any official visits. The monarch has recently been spotted used a walking stick for the first time on royal visits. Despite any recent medical wobbles, the monarch is said to be “totally committed” to entertaining her loved ones at her Norfolk home after missing out last year because of the pandemic. But royal sources said she is determined to recover soon so she can see her family at their traditional festive gathering. Last year restrictions meant the Queen and the late Prince Philip had a quiet Christmas alone at Windsor Castle. But after losing her husband of  years in April, it is understood Her Majesty really wants to see everyone together. A Palace insider said: “This year, more than ever, it is incredibly important to Her Majesty to be surrounded by her loved ones. “The Queen is totally committed to hosting everyone as she hopes to make it back to full health in the coming weeks. “Her Majesty is resting under doctors’ orders with the intention of being able to fully enjoy the company of her extended family over the holiday period. title: search britains most loveable pet
story: Search for Britain’s most loveable pet for star-studded new Mirror People’s Pet AwardsNominate your pet for the new Mirror People’s Pet Awards, with Webbox and charity partner Dogs Trust and they could be walking the red carpet alongside a host of animal-loving starsOur awards will revel in true love Image: Getty ImagesByJulie McCaffrey:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsThe search is on for Britain’s most loveable pet to take centre stage at our star-studded new awards show.The Mirror People’s Pet Awards, with Webbox and charity partner Dogs Trust, will celebrate the incredible bond between pets and their people.So tell us why you love your buddy, and what makes them so special, and they could be crowned our People’s Pet of the Year, walking the red carpet alongside a host of animal-loving stars. They don’t have to have saved a le, or overcome adversity, the award is all about rejoicing in the unique connection we have with pets.  Maybe cuddles from your cat make everything OK at the end of a tough day, or long walks with your dog keep you fit and healthy – physically and mentally. Perhaps your hamster puts a smile on your face every morning, or you just love the calming presence of a bowl of goldfish. Whatever makes your pet stand out from the crowd, tell us about them at thepeoplespetawards, and please send a picture. We will announce the finalists first and then the public will vote for the overall winner, who will be honoured at the glitzy awards dinner on Park Lane in Central London next month. We will also celebrate the hilarious beasts who light up your social media timeline. From grumpy cats to runaway dogs , nothing raises a smile quite like a pet pic or viral video. Share your favourite pet-related memes, pics and videos, and tag us @peoplespetawardsBoth the Pet of the Year and Internet Sensation will share the limelight with our other amazing award winners, including pets who have transformed lives, and people tirelessly helping animals. news uk-news shocking-moment-driver--seen-"Shocking cctv of driver flying over bridge before killing grandadByHarry Leach:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov Shocking CCTV footage shows the moment an unqualied driver lost control of a stolen car before “flying” over a bridge and killing a pedestrian. Raihan Ahmed, , was driving mph in a mph zone across a bridge in Birmingham’s Digbeth district on August . The stolen caraposs wheels at one point left the ground before landing on the other side of the bridge, smashing into -year-old former bus driver and father-of-four Ghulam Nabi, who died of his injuries.Police have released the CCTV video clips, which show Ahmed fleeing the scene at high speed before abandoning the car, BirminghamLive reports. Ahmed, of Great Barr, was arrested just  hours later following a successful appeal by the police and jailed for three-years and eight months.  He has been banned from driving for four years and ten months. The family of the victim, Mr Nabi, agreed for police to release the footage to warn drivers over the dangers of speeding. West Midlands Police detective Paul Hughes, of the forceaposs serious collision investigation unit said, “Mr Nabi was a totally innocent party in this matter and, as a pedestrian, should have been afforded safety on the pavement.  Ahmed was driving at such a speed on a public road and, in a specically restricted speed limit, that the loss of control on the bridge resulted in all four wheels leaving the road. “Itaposs always a dficult decision to release footage from such tragic cases - however this is some of the worse driving I have seen in a long time. “By releasing footage, with the support of Mr Nabi’s family, I hope it will make people think again about the responsibility they carry when driving. title: teenager who claims spiked night
story: Teenager who claims she was spiked on night out woke to find human bite mark on armHattie Brown, , said she felt really confused during a night out during which she suffered memory loss. She said she regained consciousness in the toilets of the venueHattie Brown has described regaining consciousness in a night club toilets to find a human bite mark on her arm Image: BPM MEDIAByKaty KeighleyChiara Fiorillo:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA teenager who was claimed she was spiked at a nightclub found a human bite mark on her arm when she regained consciousness. Hattie Brown said she felt really confused during a night out during which she suffered memory loss. The student at Exeter University said when she regained consciousness in the toilets of the venue, she noticed she had been bitten.She told Devon Live : Somehow I lost my friends, I looked around for them, but I don’t remember finding them.I then have a complete memory gap and I remember waking up, or regaining consciousness in the toilets, with my back up against the door.  I was really confused. I looked down at my arm and there were teeth indentations. I saw that I had been bitten by a human and I was really confused because I’ve never really heard of that happening before. I’m assuming that I must have been spiked because I don’t understand how I could have gone from being pretty much sober to having complete memory loss, and how I would have been bitten that hard on the arm without feeling it. She added: It’s one of those things where you will just never understand what was going through the mind of that person and how it happened. Part of me doesn’t want to know what happened, and I’ve kind of accepted that I won’t, but it’s so bizarre.  The -year-old said she is still suffering with bruising, swelling and pain two days later. However, she does not want this experience to stop her from going clubbing in the future and instead wants to warn others hoping it will help them stay safe on nights out. She shared her story on TikTok, gaining over , views, telling people to stay with your mates, let your mates know where you are and where you’re going.  Earlier this month, a university student said she collapsed in an AE waiting room after being allegedly spiked by injection at a nightclub. Amy Taylor said her legs felt fuzzy and her arm was bruised while she started feeling unconscious. The alleged incident happened at Fab aposNapos Halloween Guild of Students club night on October , Birmingham Live reports.The third-year human biology student said she noticed a puncture wound on her arm after being helped into an Uber to AE. She claimed she was spiked at the end of the night, between .am and am. news uk-news thomas-markle-says-meghan-deceived-"Thomas Markle glad the truth is coming out about MeghanByMilo BoydReporterLorraine King:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov Meghan Markleaposs estranged father says she aposdeceivedapos people by claiming she had not giving authorisation to a senior aide to brief the authors of her biography. Thomas Markle slammed his daughter following revelations from her then press secretary Jason Knauf that she was aware about the book Finding Freedom. The Duchess of Sussex said she had not remembered emails between her and Mr Knauf despite a spokesperson for the Sussexes insisting they did not collaborate with the authors on the book, nor were they interviewed for it In a damning interview on GB News on Thursday evening, he claimed: I cant speak to much about this but I think she was trying to deceive.  I think she was telling lies. Finally the truth is coming out and thank god for Jason Knauf. I would like him to come over so I can take him out for a steak. Meghan has apologised in a new witness statement, where she accepted that Mr Knauf did brief the authors of Finding Freedom with Meghanaposs knowledge. She said: I apologise to the Court for the fact that I had not remembered these exchanges at the time. I had absolutely no wish or intention to mislead the Defendant or the Court.  The Duchess added that had she known about the emails she would have been more than happy to refer to them as strongly supportive of her case.In the interview Thomas claimed Meghan had demanded he stopped talking to his two older children and that she had ghosted her family from both sides after marrying Prince Harry.Meghan has claimed that her two older half-siblings Samantha and Thomas had said hurtful things about her in the past.  The interview this evening comes as the Associated Newspapers Limited - the publishers of the Mail on Sunday - appeals against a summary judgement given earlier this year. Meghan had sued the company over five articles that reproduced parts of a personal and private letter sent to her dad in August . The High Court ruled ANLaposs publication of Meghanaposs letter to her father was unlawful, meaning there was no need for a trial. Mr Markle last appeared on British TV screens at the end of October when he was interviewed on Good Morning Britain.  The show was subsequently hit with a  Ofcom complaints by viewers unhappy that he had sounded off about his estranged daughter once again. The Duchess of Sussex has been the subject of a number of cutting remarks from her father and he also tore into Prince Harryaposs new tell-all book, which he branded shameful.  During the attack on the Sussexes Thomas claimed he was being ghosted by Meghan and has vowed to continue to publicly attack his daughter until she begins speaking to him again. I think Harry has abandoned the Queen, the royal family, the British people and the Army. Heaposs abandoned them all, he said on GMB. I’ve made it quite clear until I hear from her until she does speak to me that I’ll continue to do this.  I will do a show for at least a monthI can get it through and eventually sooner or later she should start talking to me - this is way too childish. This is kind of silly. It’s time to talk with each other. We’re family. At one point the retired lighting director said heaposd considered taking legal action in a bid to see his grandchildren, Archie and Lilibet. Some viewers found that suggestion galling. Thereaposs something quite tone deaf about Thomas Markle, one person wrote on social media. Surely youaposd know that your daughter has cut you off because you keep bashing her to the press  How can you be that unaware  The last time Mr Markle went on GB News was back in August this year.  He was asked by Wootton for his response to Meghanaposs comments about him, regarding the infamous paparazzi pictures he staged with an agency before her wedding. The Duchess had, in an interview with Oprah, implied her dad had intentionally caused her pain with the photos. My first response is whataposs going to happen to these children  her dad said. I donapost know what terrible things are going to happen to these children because I did some photos, I donapost know what theyaposre talking about, what Harry is talking about, he kept saying apos you do that only one kid will be protectedapos, not two, I donapost know what heaposs talking about. Why am I being picked on  It seems Iaposm very easily picked on. title: wikileaks head julian assange marry
story: WikiLeaks head Julian Assange to marry fiancee inside high security Belmarsh prisonJulian Assange, has been held in Belmarsh Prison in London since  after the United States took legal action to extradite him, will marry Stella Moris in the prisonJulian Assange will marry Stella Moris Image: CAMERA PRESS Andy GottsByAlan JonesMilo BoydReporter:,  Nov Julian Assange has been given permission to marry his partner Stella Moris in prison, it has been reported. The WikiLeaks founder has been held in Belmarsh Prison in London since  after the United States took legal action to extradite him. The couple, who met when Assange was living in the Ecuadorean embassy in London, have two children. Speaking on Twitter, Ms Moris said: I am relieved that reason prevailed and I hope there will be no further interference with our marriage. A Prison Service spokesperson said: Mr Assangeaposs application was received, considered and processed in the usual way by the prison governor, as for any other prisoner.  Assange secretly fathered two children with Morris, who has spoken in his defence at rallies, while in Londonaposs Ecuadorian embassy. The Aussie couple are expected to get married in a Catholic service in the London prisonaposs chapel, with guests chosen from fellow prisoners. Mr Assange, an Australian citizen, was arrested by police after spending five years in the Ecuadorian embassy, where he had sought political asylum as he fought to avoid extradition to Sweden, fearing he would be taken to the US for questioning over the activities of WikiLeaks. He was jailed for  months for skipping bail but was kept in Belmarsh while a y legal case was mounted by the US.  In January a judge refused the USaposs request to extradite Mr Assange, but an appeal was lodged, with the outcome still pending. No date has been set for the wedding. The couple have been engaged for a number of years and have been trying to get married despite the legal action. Their sons Gabriel, four, and Max, two, are British citizens.The couple were taking legal action against the prison governor and Justice Secretary Dominic Raab, accusing them of preventing a wedding being held. title: winter wonderland 2021 open ticket
story: When does Winter Wonderland  open  Ticket prices and opening timesThe Winter Wonderland event in Londons Hyde Park was cancelled last year due to the coronavirus pandemic, but now it is back and people can look forward to the eventWinter Wonderland in Hyde Park runs from November ,  to January ,  Image: Chris Gorman   Big LadderByBenjamin LynchSEO writer:,  Nov | comments Sleigh bells ring, are you listening  In Hyde Park, snow is glistening.Winter Wonderland in London is back and families can once again enjoy the festivities that include a circus show, ice skating and an observation wheel. Rollercoasters, live music and a whole range of food and drink will also be seen in a iety of rides, stalls and workshops, meaning there should be something for everyone who wishes to attend.The popular event was cancelled in  becuase of the coronavirus pandemic. But now it is back and is a sign of Christmas that will hopefully come without fears of of viruses and hospitalisations.But when does it start and what is dferent  When is Winter Wonderland    Winter Wonderland in Hyde Park runs from November ,  to January , . Families are advised to come earlier on in the day and adults in the later afternoon and evening. For eating and drinking, a selection of German cusines are on offer at the Baian village, while the regular festive stalls of mulled wine and hot chocolate are also there. Bar Ice is a bar made entirely of ice, including the glasses, thoughyouaposre fed up with the winter chill you can visit the fire pit. The top activities include ice skating on the UKaposs largest outdoor rink and a giant observation wheel will giving people views of the twinkling lights of London. Or you can have a go at creating their own ice sculptures. How to buy tickets for Winter Wonderland   The event organisers are insisting that people book in advance this year and are using a useful ticketing system to make sure people can plan their days.The pre-booked tickets can be bought here.Certain days are proving very popular and Saturday December  is already sold out. Tickets for the weekend are of course far more in demand and some days are also showing only limited tickets available. There are three allocated times of day for people to visit. The first is from am to pm, with the second following as pm to pm. The final time period starts at pm, before closing down for the day at pm. Tickets can be bought for free at off-peak times. Standard admissions are £ per person and are £. at peak times. Tickets become free upon admissionan inidual person spends £ or more on paid-for rides and games when booking. These attractions include:Ice skating Giant Observation Wheel Magical Ice Kingdom Circus shows Bar Ice Ice-sculpting workshops Fairground rides and gamesThe nearest tube stations include Hyde Park Corner, Knightsbridge and Marble Arch. title: adoptive parents girl 6 who
story: Adoptive parents of girl, , who said she wandered off during night charged with murderIsabella Kalua was reported missing on September , but authorities believe the little girl was in fact murdered a month before and have arrested her adoptive parents on suspicion of her deathIsabella Kalua was reported missing in September but police now believe she was killed in AugustByKate BuckNews Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov The adoptive parents of a missing six-year-old girl have been charged with her murder, police have said. Isaac Kalua, , and Lehua Kalua, , reported Isabella Kalua missing two months ago, claiming she had wandered off in the middle of the night, but despite a massive search effort she still hasnapost been found. Honolulu interim Police Chief Rade Vadic told a news conference the pair are being held without bail on suspicion of second degree murder. He added: Unfortunately what began as a search for a missing girl turned into a murder investigation. We believe that the evidence leads to the Kaluas and no one . The Kaluas adopted the little girl in January, it is understood, and legally changed her name from Ariel Sellers. When they reported Isabella missing on September  it sparked a massive search effort in Honolulu, Hawaii, where they live. But detectives have said they believe Isabella was killed in August, around a month before she was reported missing. The Kaluas were arrested by armed police who stormed the home where they live with their other children. Officers set off flash bangs brought Lehua Kalua out in handcuffs.Her husband Isaac Kalua was later arrested at his workplace of the Pearl Harbor shipyard, WAGMTV reports. Homicide Lt. Deena Thoemmes said police believed some of the information which the couple gave was  and added: There were some things that werenapost adding up for us.  She added that the pair were initially cooperative with police, until they stopped contacting them. They did open their home initially to us, provided us statements. But then as the weeks passed, there was no call back to us, she said.Authorities have refused to say what prompted police to name the Kaluas as suspects, NBC news reports. Police were seen carrying out a search in their home on Wednesday for evidence, although no body has been found.  Authorities declined to say what evidence prompted police to identy the Kaluas as suspects, nor would they comment on a potential motive. They have asked anyone who interacted with the little girl in the months leading to her disappearance to contact police. lice asked anyone who interacted with the girl or her sisters in the months leading up to her disappearance to contact authorities. There is an , reward still being offered for information which leads to her discovery.Most ReadFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON MurderCrime" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. _THP_CHP_Slug_JPG.jpg" data-tracking"facebook|share|top"" data-content-image"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES s _THP_CHP_Slug_JPG.jpg" data-tracking"twitter|share|top"" data-content-image"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES s _THP_CHP_Slug_JPG.jpg" data-tracking"whatsapp|share|top"| commentsA boy has been certied as the most premature baby to survive after being born close to  weeks early weighing less than a pound. Twin Curtis Means, who is now a healthy -month-old, was delivered in Birmingham, Alabama, in the US, last year weighing just g .The average weight of a newborn is around . lb , while a full-term pregnancy is usually  weeks.Guinness World Records has now confirmed that Curtis, who was  days - nearly  weeks - premature, set the new record. His mother, Michelle Butler, scrambled to get to the hospital after being into labour on July  , amid Independence Day celebrations.  Michelle gave birth to twins, Curtis and C’Asya, at lunchtime the next day. Little C’Asya tragically died a day later. However, Curtis beat the odds, clinging on in intensive care. Dr Brian Sims, who was the attending physician, said statistically, children born as young as the twins had virtually no chance of survival. In a statement from the University of Alabama at Birmingham, which operates the hospital, Dr Sims said doctors typically advised “compassionate care” in situations of extremely preterm births.  This allows the parents to hold their babies and cherish what little time they may have together.”But instead, Curtis grew stronger by the day and was thriving,the BBC reported.He received help from therapists to learn to breathe and to use his mouth to eat, and after  days, was eventually taken off a ventilator and discharged from hospital.  Mrs Butler, of rural Eutaw, Alabama, said in a statement: Being able to finally take Curtis home and surprise my older children with their younger brother is a moment I will always remember. While Curtis, the youngest of four, still needs supplemental oxygen and a feeding tube, doctors say he is in good health. Dr Sims, who oversaw the delivery, told Guinness World Records: Iaposve been doing this almost  years, but Iaposve never seen a baby this young be as strong as he was. There was something special about Curtis. Curtis cut a whole  hours off the previous record. Wisconsin baby Richard Hutchinson was born just a month prior, at  weeks and two days. The record had remained unbroken before Richard’s birth for  years, with the previous record holder being a baby boy born in Ottawa, Canada, at  weeks and five days. news us-news meghan-markle-stuns-gushes-over-"Prince Harry and Meghan at military awards veterans galaByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | comments Meghan Markle stunned in a red dress as she arrived with Prince Harry for an military veterans event - just hours after bombshell new evidence was heard in her privacy court case. The Duchess of Sussex, , smiled for the cameras as she glided across the red carpet in New York City. Meghan appeared in a flowing long dress at this year’s Salute to Freedom Gala at the Intrepid Sea, Air and Space Museum. She was holding hands with her husband Harry, , who looked dashing wearing a dinner jacket, bow tie and military medals. But just hours earlier - and some , miles away - the Court of Appeal in London had learned more about the writing of the bestseller Finding Freedom.  A statement from Meghan, read to the court, claimed emails between her then press secretary Jason Knauf about a meeting with the authors of the book, Omid Scobie and Carolyn Durand, had slipped her mind. In a statement, Mr Knauf noted that Meghan and Harry authorised specic cooperation in writing in December . He had advised the couple that putting the authors in touch with Meghanaposs friends was not a good idea, emails show. Being able to say hand on heart that we did not facilitate access will be important, he told the pair. A witness statement from Meghan then said she accepted that Mr Knauf did brief the authors of Finding Freedom - with her knowledge. She said: I apologise to the Court for the fact that I had not remembered these exchanges at the time.  I had absolutely no wish or intention to mislead the Defendant or the Court. The Duchess added that had she known about the emails she would have been more than happy to refer to them as strongly supportive of her case. Last year a spokesperson for the couple said they did not collaborate with the authors on the book, nor were they interviewed for it, OK reports. Despite the dayaposs revelations, the pair put on a united front on the red carpet. When a reporter asked Meghanshe was proud of Prince Harry, she replied: Iaposm always proud of him.  Harry later joked in a speech at the event that he is now living the American Dream. He said: “It’s wonderful to be back on USS Intrepid a decade after my last visit – and a lot has changed since then. Just last week, I went for a ride on the Oscar Mayer Wienermobile – how’s that for living the American dream. Each year the museum pays tribute to people in the military who have shown “extraordinary leadership” and honours the roles they have played to defend their country.  Harry continued: I’ve lived in the US for close to two years now. I have to say, witnessing your support for all those that put themselves in harm’s way in defence of our freedoms and liberties – it’s remarkable and hugely respected. “It reminds me of the deep reverence us Brits have for our military as well. The armed forces communities in both our countries share a special bond, and I’m grateful to have served in support of our joint allyship for many years.” Meghan was wearing a red Carolina Herrera dress and red shoes to match the high-slit fashion choice. She had her long locks up into a high bun. Harry had a line of four medals on his jacket along with the cross for Knight Commander of Royal Victorian Order around his neck. Palace rules mean Harry can wear medals on his jacket but was stripped of his titles after deciding to leave for the US. He was reportedly particularly upset to have the rank of Captain General of the Royal Marines taken from him. As they moved along the red carpet, it was Harry who appeared more keen to stop and chat. He was overheard to ask one person: Are you excited  Then a reporter asked him: Howaposs your grandmother  He smiled and nodded before moving on.  The Sussexes, parents to Archie, two, and five-month-old Lilibet, were both wearing a poppy. The event is held ahead of Veterans Day in the US and Remembrance Day in the UK. Harry is a special guest at the event where he will give out medals for the Intrepid Valor Awards to five service members, veterans and military families who are living with the “invisible wounds of war”. The event is particularly relevant for Harry who himself had a military background before leaving the Royal Family and moving to Calornia.  He served in the military for  years including two tours of Afghanistan and has been working with veterans as well as founding the Invictus Games - a sporting event for wounded for ex-servicemen. Harry and Meghan have been dedicating their time to charity work and humanitarian initiatives since moving to the US. Also at the veteransapos event was Jon Bon Jovi who collaborated with Harry to release a song for the Invictus Games and he received the  Intrepid Letime Achievement Award for his work as chairman of the Jon Bon Jovi Soul Foundation.We are so grateful to Prince Harry, The Duke of Sussex for honouring and amplying the stories of these heroes and helping to raise awareness for mental health support for our men and women in unorm, said Susan Marenoff-Zausner, president of the Intrepid Museum. This is their second trip to New York this year having attended the Global Citizen Live concert in Manhattan in late September. Harry has spoken out recently about the trolling of Meghan online, including over the decision by the couple to leave the UK for the US that became dubbed “Megxit”. He reportedly told the Wired’s Re:Wired Conference on Tuesday that the “term ‘Megxit’ was or is a misogynistic term and it was created by a troll, amplied by royal correspondents and it grew and grew and grew into mainstream media.”  Meghan meanwhile has said she is now feeling much better after admitting she suffered suicidal thoughts while pregnant with son Archie. The Duchess of Sussex was speaking to host Andrew Ross Sorkin at the New York Times DealBook Summit where she said stepping back from royal duties has lead to an improvement in her mental health. Mr Sorkin said there was a moment when a lot of the world was concerned and wondering about the comments she made. Meghan told an interview with Oprah Winfrey earlier this year, she had suicidal thoughts while a member of the Royal Family living in the UK.  She also alleged racism by a royal who asked her what would be the colour of her child when she was pregnant for the first time. She responded to the host that she was now feeling “better about everything. Just days ago royal biographer Andrew Morton revealed the Oprah interview was planned years in advance, shortly after the Sussexes got married. The Sussexesapos rt with the Royal Family led to them moving to the United States last year and since then they have spoken regularly to American media about problems they allege forced them to leave. title: cinema worker leaves people mortified
story: Cinema worker leaves people mortied after showing what staff can see during filmsIf youve ever smuggled in sweets, or even worse, engaged in some dodgy behaviour at the cinema, one workers revelations of what they can see might leave you horriedViewers of the viral TikTok were shocked Image: NurPhoto via Getty ImagesByRosaleen FentonAudience Writer:,  Nov | commentsCinemagoers beware - staff are aware of all the naughty things you get up to while visiting the flicks. For most of us, that boils down to sneaking in our own snacks, in a bid to stop a trip to the cinema from becoming prohibitively expensive. But for some risk-takers, it appears that they use their time during the film for X-rated acts - which is strictly forbidden. Now one cinema worker has gone viral after revealing how staff members can see exactly whataposs going on in the theatre. And it isnapost pretty. TikTok user @.noheadache went viral after sharing a video where she admitted sheaposs constantly having to look away from the CCTV screen because of some coupleaposs outrageous behaviour.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here Zooming in on the screen showing all the cinema rooms, she explained: “When people come to the cinema with their sneaky link to do the nasty.” The video, which has racked up more than  million views, is captioned: “We see everything.” The worker explained further in the comments: “We also have night vision goggles so we’ve seen it all.” In the comments, one user explained: Theyaposre for anti-piracy. Theatre hire guards for pre-screening to make sure they donapost film. They probably use them for internal use too. Viewers were left stunned - with many admitting they had no idea staff could see them eating their own food into the cinema.One wrote: “I donapost care about that. Iaposm just concerned because Iaposve been throwing popcorn at the back of peopleaposs heads for fun. Another added: “Youaposre telling me the time I snuck in a large pizza theyaposve been watching me eat   ” Well this is news to me,” a third wrote. A fourth asked: “How do people not know this  This is actually good to know in case of emergencies. I honestly had no idea, I thought you could get away with murder in there lol, commented another. One viewer joked: The only thing I be sneaky with is my snacks and food. title: hotel worker says you should
story: Hotel worker says you should avoid the complimentary breakfast at all costsIn a viral Tik Tok warning, the former hotel worker said that budget accommodation will cut corners wherever possible - and that the food served is made in a dirty kitchen and comprises of cheap ingredientsA hotel worker said you should never eat the free breakfast at a hotel Image: Getty Images Cultura RFByJohn BettAudience WriterJames RodgerRegional Content Editor:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA former hotel worker has lted the lid on budget accommodation kitchens - and said that you should avoid the full English at all costs.Brandi Augustus, who posts on TikTok as @brandiaugustus, claims to have worked at several hotels and said that the kitchens in budget chains are the worst. She said that corners are cut when it comes to cleaning, and that staff donapost give a s**t about the free fried breakfast that is offered by many hotels, as Birmingham Live reports.She said ingredients get reused and cooking equipment isnapost properly cleaned, but instead is just wiped down each day - leaving the dirt and grime to build up.  What do you think about cheap hotel breakfasts  Let us know in the comments...In her video, Brandi said: I don’t know how to say this without being attacked by people in the industry...your hotel serves the hot continental breakfast, eggs, waffles stuff like that, don’t eat that s***. That waffle batter gets reused until it starts to smell like beer. Another gross thing Brandi recalled was being told by a manager to only use a single paper towel to clean everything all night. She explains: He said it was environmentally friendly instead of using a rag or a sponge or even mostly paper towels to clean things like bowls, spatulas, the tables.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. Brandi saysyou do want to stay somewhere and eat breakfast, make sure the hotel employs a proper chef and has a hygienic kitchen. I’m just trying to save y’all a headache, she adds. The video was watched more than , times since Brandi uploaded it on Thursday, November , and it proved to be a controversial topic in the comments. One viewer said: I have worked in the food industry for over  years. Mostly worked as a morning hotel chef or manager. The buffet eggs are a no-go. A second person, who claimed to work for a popular hotel, commented: Stick to the prepackaged foods, also check the room before you bring luggage in. Not put off by the video, another person wrote: Girl itaposs free bye.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. title: wedding photographer claims can tell
story: Wedding photographer claims she can tell when a marriage is doomed from day oneWedding photographer Shayla Herrington has witnessed enough people tying the knot to tell which couples will go the distance and those who wontShayla learned about the indicators from a senior wedding photographer Image: @shaylamherrington TikTokByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Nov | comments Whenever a couple ties the knot, itaposs fair to assume theyaposre doing so in the belief they will always be together. But, in actual fact, around  percent of marriages end in orce, proving this is sadly not the case. It most instances you would assume itaposs impossible to tell whether the couple will go the distance, but according to a wedding photographer, the signs of future orce bells are a lot less subtle than youaposd think.Shayla Herrington recently took to TikTok to share the three signs that a marriage is doomed from the very beginning, according to a wedding photographer of more than  years, who shared their wisdom with her.Posting from the handle @shaylamherrington, Shayla explained: One time I was shooting under this wedding photographer, and they told me they can always tella couple will last or not, based on three things.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Mind you this photographer has been in the industry for  or  years, so I was really interested to hear their theory on this, she added. The first sign, Shayla explained, isone of the spouses takes more than three photos without their partner - which actually makes a lot of sense,you think about it. This one kinda makes sense to me, just because you might get a few with your mom and dad, but to kick them out of more than three photos, seems a little suspicious, she explained. The second indicator is the bridesmaids, or the groomsmen will avoid talking about the spouse when they are getting ready or doing toast or anything, which she explained typically means they donapost like the spouse. And finally, Shayla revealed that the third indicator the marriage will not last is when the couple spend more time with family and friends than with each other during the day. The photographer then questioned her followers over whether they believed these indicators to be true, and many shared their own experiences of weddings and orce. Yep. My ex-husband didnapost spend time with me at the wedding, and his groomsmen didnapost say hi to me at all, one TikTok user commented, while another added: It depends. My husband didnapost even MEET half my family until the wedding day so there wasnapost that relationship between him and my family.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. news weird-news we-tried-mcdonalds-christmas-menu-"McDonalds unveil limited edition Christmas menuByRosaleen FentonAudience Writer:,  Nov | comments It was the news the UK needed to hear - to much fanfare, McDonaldaposs have announced their festive menu. Itaposs getting colder, darker and weaposre about to officially enter the period of Christmas parties. So fans of McDonald’s will be pleased to hear, there is a range of suitably festive items available from November  to revive you.We visited McDonaldaposs HQ in East Finchley for a sneak peek of the menu - prepared by their in-house chefs in the test kitchen. Hereaposs what we thought. The fast-food chain is introducing two new burgers with a Christmas influence- the Festive Stack and Festive Crispy Chicken.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here I started with the Festive Stack burger This burger contains two British and Irish beef patties with red onion relish, white cheese sauce, bacon, crispy onions, red onion, lettuce, cheddar cheese in a glazed brioche-style bun. Reminiscent of the sandwich you create on Boxing Day, surrounded by leftovers, the cheese sauce is a nice touch - while the chutney jazzes up the burger. The only downside was I didnapost really notice the crispy onions - but the red onion did prove a satisfying crunch. The Festive Crispy Chicken, meanwhile, is packed with a chicken breast fillet in a crispy coating with cranberry sauce, sage and onion mayo, bacon, red onion, lettuce, cheddar cheese in a glazed poppy and sesame seed bun. This is the Christmas winner - the cranberry sauce is nice and sweet, while the sage and onion mayonnaise means that it doesnapost feel cloying. Perfect for ordering at am after drinking all the shots at the annual work Christmas do. These both retail at £. on their own or £. as part of a meal. Treat yourself, itaposs Christmas. Next up were the cheese Melt Dippers, which are made with Camembert. Iaposm a big fan of the chainaposs mozzarella sticks, so had high expectations for these, and they were met. Carby, cheesy goodness - whataposs not to love  They could have been crunchier, but I expect most people to prefer the squidge. These came with a herby ketchup, which wasnapost remarkable, but provided some tang. Four dippers cost £., but you can go all out with Cheese Melt Dippers Sharebox for £.. Next up was the Festive Pie Theyaposve taken the classic hot crispy pie and filled it with mincemeat and custard. This was a winner, but could never replace the apple-pie shaped hole in my heart, as itaposs held with such esteem. But it is a fun festival treat - perfect with a cup of coffee to fuel you while shopping for presents. This will retail at £.. We wrapped things up with the Celebrations McFlurry Itaposs the festive chocolate box of choice for many families, mixed with ice cream. Whataposs not to love  Described as soft dairy ice cream, swirled with Maltesers clusters, Galaxy chocolate drops, Caramel pieces, Mars chewy pieces and Twix biscuits, eagle-eyed fans will notice there are no Bounty pieces.Whether thataposs controversial depends on your feelings - a recent survey showedof Brits claim itaposs their least-loved chocolate.McDonaldaposs has around , restaurants in the UK.You can use its store finder tool online to locate your nearest branch. McDonaldaposs Christmas menu Festive Stack - £. on its own, £. as a meal Festive Crispy Chicken - £. on its own, £. as a meal Cheese Melt Dippers - £. Cheese Melt Dippers Sharebox - £. Celebrations McFlurry - £. for a regular, p for a mini Festive Pie - £. Choco Fudge Latte - £. for a regular, £. for a large Hot Chocolate Deluxe - £.Comment MORE ON McDonalds CorporationFoodChristmas party" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: family who live grid house
story: Family who live in off-grid house pay no bills for almost  years saving £k a yearMisty MurphAriens, , and her husband Bryce, , have become homesteaders and self sufficiency experts since moving into a remote Canadian forest  years agoMisty MurphAriens and her husband Bryce Image: Misty MurphAriens   SWNSByHarrison MooreGraeme Murray:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA family who live in an off-grid self-built aposclayapos home have paid no bills for over a decade - saving them ,a year. Misty MurphaposAriens, , and her husband Bryce , have become homesteaders - self sufficiency experts - since moving into a remote Canadian forest  years ago. They spent a few years learning tips and tricks from rural-living relatives before buying land and building a cob house - a natural material made of clay, sand and straw for just ,.The former chefs, who have daughters Sage, seven, and Aurora, five, are almost entirely self-sufficient, cooking their meals on a wooden stove.  They get electricity from solar  and use rain and a well for water, while most food comes from their own cows, chickens and ducks, and their vegetable patch. The garden grows all the traditional orchard fruits and produces a iety of nuts and vegetables which they harvest on a weekly basis. The pair reckon their lives cost just ,a year to fund which is , CADless than the average four person household in their province. Misty, from Dundalk, Ontario, said: From the moment we met we instantly knew we wanted to live an alternative lestyle.  Bryceaposs grandmotheraposs cottage was so peaceful and we were constantly disappointed when we had to leave and go back to the city. Iaposve always suffered with intense migraines but when we moved to the countryside they started to become less and less frequent. Six-months after moving theyaposd stopped completely and Iaposm convinced it was the noise and the city environment which had been the cause of my discomfort.  Rural living immediately made sense to us, and the idea of being completely self sufficient was really appealing. The couple met while working as chefs in Hamilton, but quickly realised they werenapost suited to living in the big city. Instead they opted to follow a more rural path and began learning about le on a homestead.  After visiting Bryceaposs grandmotheraposs cob cottage in rural Durham for  weekends in a row, they eventually moved there in . They spent three years learning how to lead the homestead lestyle, before going out on their own and buying a piece of farm land in the local area. In , the couple purchased the land for , despite it being covered in rubbish and abandoned materials which they spent weeks clearing  It took Misty and Bryce four months to build their aposcobapos home. Every summer since the move, they have expanded and improved their home. Their daughters are home-schooled by Misty, and taught a traditional syllabus with the addition of key primal skills, animal care and building techniques. The children have grown up learning some key skills which they may not have learned at school.  To earn money, Misty and Bryce run a small catering business in the local community, but with no car, they get around by cycling, walking or travelling on horseback. Bryce claims the reason their family is financially stable despite their lack of consistent income is their low cost, self sufficient lestyle. Weaposve worked out over the years that our annual living costs amount to approximately , - and thataposs with raising two kids, he said.  We try to be as self sufficient as possible, farming and harvesting all the food we eat. We do get the occasional shopping delivery to the nearest road, but thataposs only for a very select range of essential items. I think the dference with our lestyle is not so much what we do, but why we do it.  Of course we do have to acquire money, but the focus of our day is finding the most sustainable and fulfilling way to live. Whereas most people are spending the majority of their time working to afford the necessities of le, we spend our time working to acquire these necessities directly. Granted its not a le for everyone, but it works for us, and, as a family, weaposve never been happier. news world-news new-zealand-pm-hilariously-interrupted-"Jacinda Arderns daughter interrupts her Facebook liveByChiara Fiorillo:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | comments The New Zealand Prime Minister was hilariously interrupted by her toddler while hosting a Facebook Live to update residents on the countryaposs response to the coronavirus pandemic.Jacinda Ardern was conducting a live stream on Monday evening when her three-year-old daughter Neve entered the room, saying: Mummy  The PM replied: Youaposre meant to be in bed, darling. Itaposs bedtime, darling. Pop back to bed, Iaposll come and see you in a second. Smiling after the interruption, Mrs Ardern apologised to viewers and then told her daughter to go to her grandmother who would take her to bed. She then laughed at the camera and joked: That was a bedtime fail wasn’t it  She added: Does anyone  have kids escape like, three, four times after bedtime  Thankfully my mumaposs here so she can help out there. But shortly after the Prime Minister started addressing her viewers on the coronavirus pandemic once again, her daughter ed. Mrs Ardern told her: Iaposm sorry, darling, it is taking so long. The PM then announced she would be ending the live stream. As the pandemic forced many people to work from home, there has been an increase in the number of children jumping in while their parents are on calls or appearing on live broadcasts. In August, a New Zealand cabinet minister became embarrassed during a TV interview after her son entered the room showing a phallic carrot he had found among groceries.  Carmel Sepuloni, the minister for social development, later tweeted a video of the incident, saying: That moment when you’re doing a live interview via Zoom and your son walks into the room shouting and holding a deformed carrot shaped like a male body part.Yes, we were almost wrestling over a carrot on camera, and yes, I’m laughing about it now but wasn’t at the time!Last year, a BBC News interview with Dr Clare Wenham and Christian Fraser was photobombed by Clareaposs adorable daughter, Scarlett.The child stole the show and had viewers tweeting in droves to say how funny she was.In , Professor Robert E Kelly gained the nickname apos BBC Dadapos after his two children hilariously interrupted his live interview.Comment MORE ON Carmel SepuloniCoronavirusJacinda ArdernNew Zealand" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily coronavirus email newsletter with all the news you need to know direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Eveningcontent online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Courier. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Tayside and Fe. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Courier and the Eveningnewspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. title: john deere absence blow to rescheduled agritechnica
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you have any questions about your current subscription or how to access your subscription benefits in the future, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on   Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.The new website is now live. If you navigate to the Evening Express website or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Press and Journal website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Evening Express here.Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Evening Express content that you would expect from The Evening Express website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists. These can all be found on The Press and Journal website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from court. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Evening Express website. These articles will be marked as originally appearing on the Evening Express website.Some Evening Express content will be moved to The Press and Journal website. Your bookmarked links will automatically redirect to the corresponding page on The Press and Journal website.Yes, The Press and Journal and the Evening Express social pages will continue. We will curate content specically for our audiences through our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram channels. All articles will link to The PJ website.Your registration details that you set up on the Evening Express website will work on The Press and Journal website. Please log in to your account as normal via the top right hand corner of the website or with this link.If you have forgotten your login or password please click the password reset link and follow the instructions.Yes. All registered users can access  free articlesevery  days. Please note, this information is correct at the time of publication, however, DC Thomson reserve the right to change this in the future.No, you will no longer receive Evening Express branded newsletters. You will now receive Press and Journal newsletters. If you do not wish to receive these, click the #unsubscribe# link at the bottom of the newsletter email.The Press and Journal has a Web subscription available which will give you access to all content on site from The Press and Journal and the Evening Express. You can purchase a Press and Journal Web or Press and Journal ePaper subscription here.If you have an existing Evening Express Web subscription then all your subscription benefits are now available on The Press and Journal site. You have access to a bigger and better website, with all your favourite Evening Express content plus more.If you need help deciding what subscription is best for you, our Digital News Subscriptions Team are standing by to help. title: cover crops drive production at balbirnie home farms
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. title: how many covid 19 absences are there compared to last year
story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details. To reset your password please use the following link.Please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team, on  Monday # Friday, am # pm, or email.Your subscription will continue as normal and all your existing subscriber benefits will remain in place. There are changes as to how you access your subscription benefits. See below, depending on what type of subscription you have.If you are an existing Evening Express Web subscriber, you can log in to your account as normal through The Press and Journal website.If you have an ePaper subscription you can access your ePaper on The Press and Journal website here.Or via a new link in your Daily ePaper email.There is no change to your reoccurring billing agreement. If you purchase a new subscription through The PJ website the price is subject to change and may be more than your current subscription. If you navigate to the Evening Express website or have website links saved, you will be automatically redirected to The Press and Journal website.Yes. You will find all the content that you would have normally found at the Evening Express here.Our combined newsroom will deliver you all of the Evening Express content that you would expect from The Evening Express website, plus more! We will continue to bring you the very best local news, football insight and in-depth features, as well as your favourite Evening Express columnists. These can all be found on The Press and Journal website as well as live news # updated as it happens # breaking crime news and the latest from court. You can also find our very best content that was published originally on the Evening Express website. These articles will be marked as originally appearing on the Evening Express website.Some Evening Express content will be moved to The Press and Journal website. Your bookmarked links will automatically redirect to the corresponding page on The Press and Journal website.Yes, The Press and Journal and the Evening Express social pages will continue. We will curate content specically for our audiences through our Facebook, Twitter and Instagram channels. All articles will link to The PJ website.Your registration details that you set up on the Evening Express website will work on The Press and Journal website. Please log in to your account as normal via the top right hand corner of the website or with this link.If you have forgotten your login or password please click the password reset link and follow the instructions.Yes. story: We are excited to announce a new home for the Evening Express content online, with a bigger and better website in partnership with The Press and Journal. We have spoken to our readers, and our aim is to deliver you everything that you need to know, together in one place.If you are a subscriber or thinking about joining our digital community, find out what it means for you below.In order to give you access to the news that you need, we have expanded our newsrooms and created dedicated news teams to serve you and our extended local communities across Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, the Highlands and Islands and the North and North-East of Scotland. We will deliver you more content, live news as it happens, as well as breaking crime news and the latest from court, together in one place. We have also found new ways of telling our stories online, from in-depth investigations through to full- documentaries and podcasts.There is no change to The Press and Journal and the Evening Express newspaper or ePapers. The newspapers will continue to be available for purchase at your local store, delivered to your home, or as an ePaper . We will continue to deliver you the best stories in print, that you have come to expect from the PJ and the Evening Express.Our ePapers are a full replica version of the newspaper, published online,  days a week. You can access the PJ and the Evening Express ePaper via our dedicated ePaper apps where you can save and share stories, access all the paper supplements easily via their dedicated menu and even play interactive puzzles!If you would like to find out more about subscribing to the PJ or the Evening Express ePaper, please contact our Digital News Subscriptions Team on Your subscription to the Press and Journal will allow you to access all of the Evening Express stories which are now available on the PJ website. All of the best Evening Express content, including columnists and football analysis will now appear on the PJ website and will be available for you as part of your subscription.If you have an ePaper subscription there will be no change as to how you access your Press and Journal ePaper.The new website is now live. Evening Express content can now be found on The Press and Journal website.When you purchased your subscription an email was sent to your account with your login details.
